questions.question: I wish I ................................ better.
questions.description: We use a past tense after I wish to talk about our wishes.

questions.question: I wish I .................................. taller.
questions.description: We use a past tense after I wish to talk about our wishes.

questions.question: I do have some regrets. I wish I ................................... harder.
questions.description: We use past perfect after I wish to talk about unfulfilled past wishes.

questions.question: My mother ..................................... knit beautiful sweaters.
questions.description: We use can to talk about ability.

questions.question: He ..................................... drive four wheelers.
questions.description: We use can to mean 'know how to'.

questions.question: We will ........................................... reach there on time.
questions.description: We cannot use can after will.

questions.question: How much time can you devote ...................................... English?
questions.description: Devote is followed by to + ing form.

questions.question: I hope that date is not set in ................................
questions.description: If a date is set in stone, it cannot be changed.

questions.question: He is a busy man without ..................................... patience.
questions.description: Patience is an uncountable noun. We use much before uncountable nouns.

questions.question: You ............................... better mend your ways.
questions.description: Had better refers to the present and future. There is no such thing as have better.

questions.question: Here is my number just ......................................... you would like to keep in touch with me.
I enjoy ........................................ time with you.
questions.description: We use an ing form after enjoy.

questions.question: They ……………… the Emperor’s body away on a stretcher.
questions.description: Bear means carry. Bore is the past tense of bear.

questions.question: Thousands of children ………………… blind every year.
I want to get married but ………………. I have to find a job.
questions.description: Either before that or first can be used here.

questions.question: I will phone before I .....................
questions.description: In clauses with before, we use a present tense if the meaning is future.

questions.question: Where are the ………………. mangoes?
questions.description: When other is used with a noun, it does not have a plural form.

questions.question: He looked at me ………………. strange.
questions.description: Real is possible here in an informal style. This is common in American English.

questions.question: I wasn’t ..................... to enter the house.
questions.description: Let is not usually used in the passive voice.

questions.question: My dog understands everything – he is ………………. human.
questions.description: Almost can mean ‘similar to, but not exactly the same’.

questions.question: I met Sally in Germany ………………….
questions.description: We use ‘ago’ with a past tense and a time expression to count back from the present.

questions.question: The dog was barking ……………..
questions.description: The article ‘the’ is usually left out in expressions like all day, all night, all week, all summer etc.

questions.question: I would have been in real trouble ………………. your help.
questions.description: The expression ‘but for’ can mean ‘if something had not happened / existed.

questions.question: My daughter is not interested in anything but …………….
questions.description: After ‘interested in’ you need a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: It is time we .......................
questions.description: After it’s time, we use a past tense to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: I …………….. them a couple of times when I was in London.
questions.description: We use the simple past with expressions referring to the past.

questions.question: I ………………….. him before.
questions.description: When there is no reference to a definite point of time in the past, we use a present perfect tense to talk about past events.

questions.question: I ………………….. it if I were you.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: It’s a long time ……………. I went there.
She is ……………… today.
questions.description: Better is the comparative form of good. We cannot say ‘more good’.

questions.question: I was surprised to see that ……………. James was there.
questions.description: We use ‘even’ to talk about surprising extremes. Even if and even though are conjunctions.

questions.question: I bought the watch ……………….. it was very expensive.
questions.description: Even though is the emphatic form of ‘though’. It has a past reference.

questions.question: I will buy that watch …………………. it is very expensive.
questions.description: Even if has a future reference.

questions.question: He ……………. the phone and quickly dialed the number.
questions.description: To reach for something is to stretch your arms to grab it.

questions.question: The first time I …………….. him was last year.
questions.description: We use the simple past with definite past time expressions.

questions.question: Take the certificates with you just in case they ……………… you a job.
No football team ....................... championship without defenders.
How many players ……………….. in a baseball team?
…………………., a deer leapt out in front of me.
answers: While I was driving down the road
I was driving down the road

questions.question: The Turks .....................… Constantinople in 1453 and that was the end of the Byzantine Empire.
Although it ………………….. for days, the cricket pitch was in perfect condition.
.......................Italian well, but she could not understand the Genoese dialect.
